item.title: Need A Happiness Boost? Spend Your Money To Buy Time, Not More Stuff
item.description: August 28, 2017 - A recent study suggests that when people spend their extra cash to get help with time-consuming chores, they're likelier to feel better than if they use the money to buy more things.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 28, 2017 - A recent study suggests that when people spend their extra cash to get help with time-consuming chores, they're likelier to feel better than if they use the money to buy more things. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/28/545839192/need-a-happiness-boost-spend-your-money-to-buy-time-not-more-stuff

item.title: Houston Mayor Sylvester Turner On Hurricane Harvey Preparedness
item.description:
August 27, 2017 - Michel Martin talks to Houston Mayor Sylvester Turner about the storm pummeling the region.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/08/27/546604737/houston-mayor-sylvester-turner-on-the-lead-up-to-hurricane-harvey

item.title: Coast Guard Update: Houston Search And Rescue Efforts
item.description: August 27, 2017 - NPR's Michel Martin talks to a representative from the U.S. Coast Guard, Captain Kevin D. Oditt, about the how the search and rescue efforts are going in the city of Houston.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Houston Weather Forecast Update
item.description:
August 27, 2017 - NPR's Michel Martin talks to meteorologist Eric Berger about the forecast for the city of Houston over the next few days.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/08/27/546603401/houston-weather-forecast-update

item.title: Meteorologist On Hurricane Historical Texas Damage
item.description: August 27, 2017 - Hurricane Harvey is causing much more damage than other hurricanes have in Texas. NPR's Michel Martin interviews Dr. Neil Frank, former director of the National Hurricane Center and longtime meteorologist, about why this storm is so bad.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 27, 2017 - Hurricane Harvey is causing much more damage than other hurricanes have in Texas. NPR's Michel Martin interviews Dr. Neil Frank, former director of the National Hurricane Center and longtime meteorologist, about why this storm is so bad. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/27/546603354/meteorologist-on-hurricane-historical-texas-damage

item.title: Eclipse 2017: One Nation Under The Sun
item.description:
August 27, 2017 - For many, witnessing the total solar eclipse on Monday, Aug. 21, 2017, was the event of a lifetime.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/08/27/546109041/eclipse-2017-one-nation-under-the-sun

item.title: The Consequences Of Anti-Vaccination In 'Keep You Safe'
item.description: August 27, 2017 - Host A Martinez talks with Melissa Hill about her new novel, Keep You Safe, a story which takes on the heated topic of childhood vaccinations and the tragic repercussions of a parent's decision.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 27, 2017 - Host A Martinez talks with Melissa Hill about her new novel, Keep You Safe, a story which takes on the heated topic of childhood vaccinations and the tragic repercussions of a parent's decision. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/27/546497351/the-consequences-of-anti-vaccination-in-keep-you-safe

item.title: As Houston-Area Suburbs Wait For Harvey To Blow Over, Temporary Fixes Abound
item.description: August 26, 2017 - In wealthy Sierra Plantation, crews are working hard to patch roofs and clear debris from downed trees. But it's all just a temporary solution until the storm's cycle brings more damage.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 26, 2017 - In wealthy Sierra Plantation, crews are working hard to patch roofs and clear debris from downed trees. But it's all just a temporary solution until the storm's cycle brings more damage. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/26/546406272/as-houston-area-suburbs-wait-for-harvey-to-blow-over-temporary-fixes-abound

item.title: Why Don't We Have Princess Leia Holograms Yet?
item.description: August 26, 2017 - Researchers continue to chase down the sci-fi holy grail of genuine free-standing holograms — and they're getting pretty close. One obstacle: Current computing systems just aren't up to it.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 26, 2017 - Researchers continue to chase down the sci-fi holy grail of genuine free-standing holograms — and they're getting pretty close. One obstacle: Current computing systems just aren't up to it. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/08/26/546084473/why-don-t-we-have-princess-leia-holograms-yet

item.title: What's Making These Dogs In Mumbai Turn Blue?
item.description: August 26, 2017 - Five dogs with this unusual hue were found in an industrial area of Mumbai. The hunt for its cause revealed a much bigger problem.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 26, 2017 - Five dogs with this unusual hue were found in an industrial area of Mumbai. The hunt for its cause revealed a much bigger problem. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/26/546049293/whats-making-these-dogs-in-mumbai-turn-blue

item.title: 'I Will Lose My Identity': Cambodian Villagers Face Displacement By Mekong Dam
item.description: August 26, 2017 - Thousands are being displaced by new dam construction. "I cannot leave my ancestors here," says a woman whose village will be submerged by the dam. "If I abandon them, I won't know who I am."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 26, 2017 - Thousands are being displaced by new dam construction. "I cannot leave my ancestors here," says a woman whose village will be submerged by the dam. "If I abandon them, I won't know who I am." http://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2017/08/26/546036670/i-will-lose-my-identity-cambodian-villagers-face-displacement-by-mekong-dam

item.title: Having A Best Friend In Your Teenage Years Could Benefit You For Life
item.description: August 26, 2017 - Researchers have found that people with deep friendships in adolescence had less anxiety and a greater sense of self-worth in early adulthood. Close friends matter, their study found.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 26, 2017 - Researchers have found that people with deep friendships in adolescence had less anxiety and a greater sense of self-worth in early adulthood. Close friends matter, their study found. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/26/543739986/having-a-best-friend-in-your-teenage-years-could-benefit-you-for-life

item.title: This Music Teacher Played His Saxophone While In Brain Surgery
item.description: August 25, 2017 - The surgeons tasked with removing a tumor from Dan Fabbio's brain had worked hard not to disrupt his ability to perform music. They rejoiced when he was able to play his sax on the operating table.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 25, 2017 - The surgeons tasked with removing a tumor from Dan Fabbio's brain had worked hard not to disrupt his ability to perform music. They rejoiced when he was able to play his sax on the operating table. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/25/545710598/this-music-teacher-played-his-saxophone-while-in-brain-surgery

item.title: Science 'Gone Wrong' Can Teach Us
item.description: August 25, 2017 - Pandora's Lab stresses that for science to work, it needs to base claims on data, studies need to be replicable, and scientists must be more attached to science than to their own ideas, says Alva Noë.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 25, 2017 - Pandora's Lab stresses that for science to work, it needs to base claims on data, studies need to be replicable, and scientists must be more attached to science than to their own ideas, says Alva Noë. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/08/25/545508337/science-gone-wrong-can-teach-us

item.title: Moshe Szyf: How Do Our Experiences Rewire Our Brains And Bodies?
item.description: August 25, 2017 - Many think genetic makeup is fixed from the moment we're born. But Moshe Szyf says this understanding is incomplete because our experiences and environment have the power to change our basic biology.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 25, 2017 - Many think genetic makeup is fixed from the moment we're born. But Moshe Szyf says this understanding is incomplete because our experiences and environment have the power to change our basic biology. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/25/545092951/moshe-szyf-how-do-our-experiences-rewire-our-brains-and-bodies
